meanings.definition: A person with much worldly experience and knowledge of fashion and culture.
meanings.sent1: The sophisticated lady always knew the latest fashion trends.
meanings.sent2: The sophisticate attended all the high-class events in the city.
meanings.sent3: The young sophisticate tried to imitate the elegant style of the older women.
meanings.sent4: She was a true sophisticate, effortlessly blending into any social circle.
meanings.sent5: The sophisticated gentleman's refined taste was admired by all.

meanings.definition: To make more complex or refined.
meanings.sent1: She wanted to sophisticate her wardrobe by adding some elegant accessories.
meanings.sent2: The chef decided to sophisticate the simple dish with exotic spices.
meanings.sent3: He tried to sophisticate his drawing by adding intricate details.
meanings.sent4: The artist's goal was to sophisticate his technique to create masterful paintings.
meanings.sent5: The designer aimed to sophisticate the basic dress into a glamorous gown.

meanings.sent1: The criminal tried to sophisticate the evidence to mislead the investigators.
meanings.sent2: It is illegal to sophisticate official documents to change the information.
meanings.sent3: The prankster decided to sophisticate his friend's drink by adding salt instead of sugar.
meanings.sent4: The scammer attempted to sophisticate the product labels to sell counterfeit goods.
meanings.sent5: The dishonest seller would sophisticate the expiration dates on perishable items.
